pullRequest.body:
Add characterization of limsup and limsup of max.

---

This PR adds to Order.LiminfLimsup:

- Characterizations of the limsup and liminf in Conditionally complete linear orders: `limsup_le_iff`, `le_limsup_iff`, `le_liminf_iff`, `liminf_le_iff`.
- Identities such as limsup max = max limsup: `limsup_max`, `liminf_min`. Some lemmas about bounded/cobounded functions to handle limsup max.
- Same identities with supremum/infimum indexed over a Finset: `limsup_finset_sup`, `liminf_finset_inf`, `limsup_finset_sup'`, `liminf_finset_inf'`.
- ~Some identities defined on Conditionally complete linear orders now have versions on Complete linear orders. The autocomplete tactic doesn't work very well, so in practice they can be very helpful. Example: `limsup_le_limsup'`.~

This file is in dire need of a refactor. It is getting too long ; the linter fails because the file has reached almost 1800 lines (I am not sure if it makes sense to disable the flag as long as we don't go over the limit of 1900 lines). There are many less immediate issues which would warrant some extensive work.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [d2910fe624](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14564/commits/d2910fe624b1ea3f07a2fcb97d57560f6a05a5ad)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ isBoundedUnder_ge_finset_inf`
`+ isBoundedUnder_ge_finset_inf'`
`+ isBoundedUnder_le_finset_sup`
`+ isBoundedUnder_le_finset_sup'`
`+ isCoboundedUnder_ge_finset_inf'`
`+ isCoboundedUnder_le_finset_sup'`
`+ isCoboundedUnder_le_max`
`+ le_liminf_iff`
`+ le_limsup_iff`
`+ liminf_finset_inf`
`+ liminf_finset_inf'`
`+ liminf_le_iff`
`+ liminf_min`
`+ limsup_finset_sup`
`+ limsup_finset_sup'`
`+ limsup_le_iff`
`+ limsup_max`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Hi @D-Thomine, I have just updated `style-exceptions.txt` as discussed [here](https://github.com/mseri/BET/issues/55#issuecomment-2217706009) and [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Porting.20TopologicalEntropy.20into.20Mathlib/near/450168092) to avoid the `ERR_NUM_LIM` lint error. 

I'm going to golf a few proofs.

Opening this PR for review. Apart from some golfing:

- @pitmonticone has added a style exception so that the linter stops complaining about the length of the file (thanks!).
- I've removed the duplicate lemmas which gave simpler versions of some theorems on Complete lattices / Complete linear orders.
- I've modified some lemmas about IsBoundedUnder/IsCoboundedUnder for finite sup/inf. One lemma about the sup was not useful, while I've added two lemmas about the inf which are.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9922275088/job/27411149981)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9922275088/job/27411150159)
Looks good, thanks!

Normally, one should never need this lemma, as the original lemma `limsup_le_limsup` should apply (and the boundedness assumption should be automatically filled in). This being said, I remember cases where the autoparam did not fire. If you have an example where `limsup_le_limsup'` works but `limsup_le_limsup` doesn't, it might be worth mentioning on Zulip, because it's probably a bug.

My feeling is that autoparam works well with e.g. the `exact` tactic, but not the `apply` tactic. But, yes, I agree that the right solution is to fix autoparam instead of adding duplicate lemmas (and then delete the duplicate lemmas).

I have a dozen of examples of autoparam not firing. I will try to write some minimal examples for Zulip.

For my issues with the automatic fill-in: I've opened a [Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics/topic/isBoundedDefault.20not.20triggering/near/450437091).

In the meantime, these specialized versions are removed. Better to work now with a wonky tool which will, hopefully, be fixed, than to have to delete lemmas (with all the downstream effects) later.

```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun h _ h' ↦ eventually_lt_of_limsup_lt (lt_of_le_of_lt h h') h₂, fun h ↦ ?_⟩
```
In this way, you can unindent the rest of the proof. In general, when one of the branches is a one-liner like here, it's good practice to eliminate it right away.

```suggestion
    exact mem_of_superset (inter_mem hu hv) (fun _ ↦ by simp)
```
Done.
For symmetry, what about a `sup` version for this one also?
It is already in the file, under the name `isCobounded_le_of_bot` :)
instead of doing twice the same proof, is it possible to deduce this one from the `sup'` version, separating the cases where `s` is empty or not?
Nice idea, it works very well (and made me notice an imprecision in some statements : I now write `limsup (fun a ↦ sup s (fun i ↦ F i a)) f` instead of `limsup (fun a ↦ sup s F a) f`).

```suggestion
    (h₁ : ∀ i ∈ s, f.IsCoboundedUnder (· ≤ ·) (F i) := by exact fun i hi ↦ by isBoundedDefault)
    (h₂ : ∀ i ∈ s, f.IsBoundedUnder (· ≤ ·) (F i) := by exact fun i hi ↦ by isBoundedDefault) :
```
Same thing below.
Nice idea. Tested, and in works!

Is it possible instead to state this assuming `[ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder β] [OrderBot β]` instead? In this way, it would be also dualizable to a liminf version, which is not possible currently.

This requires a tweak to another file. The lemma `csInf_univ` required a `ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot`, but its assumptions can be weakened to `ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder` + `OrderBot`. With this modification, which should not break anything else, this works.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order.LiminfLimsup): add limsup_max
